alert.note: Alert for Iowa; Johnson; Keokuk; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 2:56AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Keokuk, central Johnson, Washington, northwestern Jefferson and southern Iowa Counties through 400 AM CDT... At 256 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Williamsburg to near Keswick to near Hedrick. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Williamsburg and Parnell around 300 AM CDT. South English around 305 AM CDT. North English and Harper around 310 AM CDT. Kinross around 315 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Oxford, Wellman, Richland, Coralville, North Liberty, Tiffin, Oakdale, Kalona, University Heights, Hills and Richmond. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 207 and 252. Interstate 380 between mile markers 1 and 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in the Quad Cities.
